name: ifpor
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: sylbi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wi(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wo(w1, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wi(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wo(w1, w2))

body.origin: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2))
-| wi(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wo(w1, w2))

stmt.origin: orim12i(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2), w1, w2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wo(w1, w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), w1)
-| wi(wa(wn(w0), w2), w2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), w1)
-| wi(wa(wn(w0), w2), w2)

|- wi(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(w1, w2))
-| wi(wa(wn(w0), w2), w2)

comment: The conditional operator implies the disjunction of its possible outputs. Dual statement of ~ anifp . (Contributed by BJ, 1-Oct-2019.)
